qas.question: Is there a pplace where lovers of the chicken are able to see some of its best attributes ?

answers.text: In many countries, national and regional poultry shows are held where enthusiasts exhibit their birds

qas.question: In such competitions what are the chickens juged on? What attibutes are considered viable?

answers.text: birds which are judged on certain phenotypical breed traits as specified by their respective breed standards

qas.question: Are there breed standards used for the competitions?

answers.text: Breed standards were drawn up for egg-laying, meat-type, and purely ornamental birds, aiming for uniformity

qas.question: What are some of the most widely known poultry tournaments?

answers.text: the annual "National Championship Show" in the United Kingdom organised by the Poultry Club of Great Britain.

qas.question: From where does the idea of a poultry tournament orginate?

answers.text: The idea of poultry exhibition may have originated after cockfighting was made illegal, as a way of maintaining a competitive element in poultry husbandry

qas.question: Where are national and regional poultry shows banned?
What was never made illegal that involves birds fighting?
What are never part of general livestock shows?

plausible_answers.text: the annual "National Championship Show" in the United Kingdom organised by the Poultry Club of Great Britain

qas.question: What are the unknown poultry tournaments?
Why are poultry shows not allowed in most countries?

context: <a0_0><b5_0>In many countries<b5_0/>, national and regional poultry shows are held where <b9_0>enthusiasts exhibit their <a1_0>birds<b9_0/><a0_0/> which are judged on certain phenotypical breed traits as specified by their respective breed standards<a1_0/>. <a4_0>The idea of poultry exhibition may have originated after <b6_0>cockfighting<b6_0/> was made illegal, as a way of maintaining a competitive element in poultry husbandry<a4_0/>. <a2_0>Breed standards were drawn up for egg-laying, meat-type, and purely ornamental birds, aiming for uniformity<a2_0/>. Sometimes, <b7_0>poultry shows<b7_0/> are part of general livestock shows, and sometimes they are separate events such as <a3_0><b8_0>the annual "National Championship Show" in the United Kingdom organised by the Poultry Club of Great Britain<b8_0/>.
